sources.title: Force of Impulse (1961) TONY ANTHONYüçï TEENSPLOITATION
sources.description:
1st TIME on YouTube!
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: Tony Anthony,  J. Carrol Naish, Robert Alda, Teri Hope
Director: Saul Swimmer

In this Teensploitation oddity, there's trouble ahead when a teen from the wrong side of the tracks chases a gal way above his pay grade. Watch for the strong supporting cast of J. Carrol Naish and Robert Alda, plus newbies Christina Crawford (Joan Crawford's daughter) and Jody McCrea (son of Joel McCrea.)  

TRIVIA: Tony Anthony, born Tony Roger Petitto on October 16, 1937, is a notable figure in the Spaghetti Western genre. His portrayal of "The Stranger" in a trio of films and his role in "Blindman" have earned him a dedicated following among enthusiasts.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

metadata.Plot: A high-school football player is in love with a beautiful blonde classmate from a very wealthy family. He doesn't have the money to take her out, so in his desperation he robs his own father's grocery store. Things go downhill from there.
metadata.Writer: Tony Anthony, Richard Bernstein, Francis Swann
metadata.Actors: Robert Alda, J. Carrol Naish, Tony Anthony
